newsitem.title: INDIA: India Tata plans to integrate software companies.
newsitem.headline: India Tata plans to integrate software companies.

text.p: India's Tata group is trying to integrate operations of the various software companies within its fold, its chairman said on Thursday.
"Consolidation (of these firms into one firm) is a difficult issue," Tata group chairman Ratan Tata told a news conference.
"In the first phase, we should see if they can work together in synergy," Tata said.
He said his group, India's largest business house, was often criticised by the media for the multiplicity of information technology firms in its fold.
These include Tata Consultancy Services, Tata Unisys Ltd (now renamed Tata Infotech) and Tata Elxsi.

Tata was addressing a news conference to launch a new firm Tata Technologies Ltd to market engineering software in association with SAP AG, Concentra Corporation, Tata Elxsi and Tata Informationn Systems Ltd.
